communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Employee Numbers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Wednesday, January 3rd 2023 

1. All records showing the number of CERTIFIED JAILERS Employed
January the 1st 2018 until December 31st, 2007
January the 1st 2019 until December 31st, 2008
January the 1st 2020 until December 31st, 2009
January the 1st 2021 until December 31st, 2010
January the 1st 2022 until December 31st, 2011
January the 1st 2023 until October 20, 2012

2. A list of all CERTIFIED POLICE OFFICERS that have quit or resigned from 01/01/2007 to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

communications.subject: Welcome to the Open Records Request Portal!
communications.communication:
Dear Bernadette Feazell, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Open Records Request Portal. 
 
Your Login ID is:  156599-97703564@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HQD5Ni-2BjRYLEWACoSf8-2FgUYIFVkZu6jLgMYnrFjhxKIkoLeHYqe1oEd0w0wxfiuxMedkwX2TV4Z9wntaA6uW4JA-3Dmf6I_pp5HrawYXiJ9L4sMASrzNkSuh7Iz2CynQrwtwvHv89JgfPCwRcfSeZFCyYzzUHagdHrv5TIO9JUaZOW2gtVl8wHyFp7-2Beu-2FPt-2FAk-2Bf645oIQ9Fg176MHDxAFa58Fz94IRg9dF-2BOKsITs1Agc9bnb4QoAiP3-2BokVJHhZH8pdAmdJ2CbnPqz45-2BQqBbnBft3DBfdATyuCWlINxx4G14cev-2F4SMn-2FyWsjL2KH941EsXPQ4-3D)

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: State of Virginia Salaries 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

State of Virginia 2024 Compensation Data for All Employees
Please provide the following fields for each employee in the dataset:
Employee # | FIrst Name | Middle Name/Initial | Last Name | Employee Role Title | Position Number | Agency Name | Agency Location | Agency Address | Agency City/State/ZIP | Employee Category | Compensation (Base Pay, Salary, Hourly Rate, Total Pay, etc) | Overtime | Benefits Pay | Date Hired | Date Terminated | FT/PT

Note: If not all fields listed above are releasable as public record or available please disregard those individual fields for this request.

The following fields were provided in a request for 2023 data and the same fields for 2024 will satisfy this request:
Business Unit |	Company |	Agency Description | 	Last Name |	First Name |	Empl Class |	Employee Type |	Job Std Hours |	Position Description |	VPA Only |	Job Code |	Standard Occup Classification |	Salary Plan	Grade |	Step |	Reg/Temp |	Full- Part Time	 |State Comp Rate |	Non State Comp Rate |	Special Comp Rate |	Combined Comp Rate |	Hourly Comp Rate |	FTE |	Company Seniority Date |	Employee State Begin Date


I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by either e-mail attachment or FTP Download if available, otherwise sent through mail via CD/DVD. I would appreciate the request to be filled in an accessible format, including but not limited to: CSV, Excel, Microsoft Access database, or other bulk list file type.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Tyler King.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - CIA - Niklaus Wirth
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Niklaus Emil Wirth (15 February 1934 – 1 January 2024) - Swiss-born computer scientist and designer of several programming languages, and the name behind “Wirth’s Law”  (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niklaus_Wirth )

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - Niklaus Wirth
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Niklaus Emil Wirth (15 February 1934 – 1 January 2024) - Swiss-born computer scientist and designer of several programming languages, and the name behind “Wirth’s Law”  (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niklaus_Wirth )

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies.

If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Clowns 1.2.24
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of all records responsive to clown sightings and threats made by individuals identifying as clowns between January 01, 2016 and December 31, 2018. 

In August 2016, reports of clown sightings in Greenville, South Carolina set off a national panic and residents of multiple states claimed to have interactions with individuals dressed in clown costumes and making threats against schools. On multiple occasions law enforcement officials stated that the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) was involved with investigations related to these sightings and threats. The following stories appeared around the country in September 2016:

1) Gallatin County Sheriff Josh Neale stated that he was consulting with the FBI on one such case involving terroristic threats at the Gallatin County Schools in Gallatin County, Kentucky. According to WCPO, an ABC affiliate based out of Cincinnati, Ohio: "Neale has contacted the FBI and Homeland Security and said the person or people making the 'clown threats' could face local charges of inducing panic and terroristic threatening."

A link can be found here: https://www.wcpo.com/news/state/state-kentucky/creepy-clowns-threaten-kentucky-schools

2) Officers working for the Phoenix Police Department stated that the FBI and its Phoenix Joint Terrorism Task Force assisted in an investigation after threats were made against 24 schools in the Phoenix Union and Glendale school districts. According to ABC 13, an ABC affiliate based out Houston, Texas: "Police did not specify what the threats said, only that it involved violence and the same clown image. A terrorism task force and the FBI are assisting police with their investigation, officers said."

A link can be found here: https://abc13.com/clown-threats-phoenix-union-glendale-school-district-social-media/1529983/

3) FBI agents participated in a search of Flomaton High School connected to online threats. According to the Washington Post: "Callaway Middle School was not the only school involved in the clown brouhaha. In the Alabama city of Flomaton, messages from a Facebook page called 'Flomo Klown' — pictures of threatening clowns plus text that read, 'I kill people for a living' — prompted another lockdown Thursday. FBI agents and dozens of local police scoured the school campus. Officials said they found no clown or other suspicious evidence; they later arrested Makayla Smith, 22, and two juvenile Alabama residents for allegedly making the threats. Smith’s bond was set at $200,000 on Monday."

A link can be found here: https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2016/09/20/creepy-clowns-police-begin-making-arrests-as-false-reports-and-threats-plague-southern-towns/

Given that law enforcement officials in numerous cities claimed that they either consulted with or had knowledge of FBI involvement in investigations related to clown sightings, it is reasonable to conclude that records were created by the FBI in these cases and potentially others. Therefore, I am requesting all records related to clown sightings and threats made by individuals identifying as clowns in the period of January 01, 2016 to December 31, 2018

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. My bylines, which include Unicorn Riot, the Geopolitical Economy Report, and Creem Magazine, can be found in both print and electronic publications. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

A fee waiver is appropriate in situations where "disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government, and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester,” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(iii). Over the course of 2016, the reports of clown sightings caused a national panic, resulting in school closures and lockdowns. Understanding how a federal agency like the FBI assisted in managing that panic can offer insight into best practices for responding to national security emergencies related to mass hysterias and panics in the future.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said destruction or transfer, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the bureau has no other copies of said records.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Boston Unsolved murder (Boston Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list and or database of unsolved murders/homicides, including but not limited to: 

• Datasets and/or databases that house such information
• All releasable information related to the murdered person
• Any other data structures used for the management of records: digital, paper, and otherwise

I request that you release records for this request on a rolling basis as they become available and in electronic form. If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address. If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Albert Serna Jr.

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: B000070-010824
communications.communication:
Dear Albert Serna 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Boston Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 1/8/2024 8:58:23 PM and given the reference number B000070-010824 for tracking purposes. 
If this is a media request, please contact the Office of Media Relations directly at 617.343.4520. 
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list and or database of unsolved murders/homicides, including but not limited to:

• Datasets and/or databases that house such information
• All releasable information related to the murdered person
• Any other data structures used for the management of records: digital, paper, and otherwise

I request that you release records for this request on a rolling basis as they become available and in electronic form. If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address. If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Albert Serna Jr.

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: B000070-010824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

First, your request does not comply with the Public Records Law (PRL), G.L. c. 66 and 950 C.M.R. 32.00. Your request is excessively broad, and so broad that it is not permitted by the PRL. The Supervisor of Public Records requires that public records requests must reasonably describe the records sought. G. L. c. 66, § 10(a)(i). 
In a recent Suffolk Superior Court case, the court found that under the PRL “[t]he reasonable description requirement contemplates that a requesting party will identify documents or categories of documents with sufficient particularity that government employees will be able to understand exactly what they are looking for, and then make a prompt production.” , Suffolk. Sup. No. 1784CV02087, at 2 (January 23, 2019). Chawla v. Dep't of Revenue 
The court further indicated “[r]equests for documents that are articulated with very broad language that calls upon non-lawyer administrative personnel to interpret the scope of what is sought, and then make fine judgments about what documents are and are not sufficiently ‘related’ to the category of materials requested, will satisfy this statutory standard.” not Id. (emphasis in original). 
In accordance with G. L. c. 66, § 10(a)(i) and the Chawla decision described above, whereas you seek “all information and documents” or “any and all communications, documents, e-mails, text messages, voice recordings, and other information or tangible evidence” “pertaining” to elections for example, it is unclear with “sufficient particularity” which records you seek. Thus, your request “calls upon non-lawyer administrative personnel to interpret the scope of what is sought, and then make fine judgments about what documents are and are not sufficiently ‘[regarding]’ the category of materials requested.” Chawla, at 2. 
Therefore, your request is not legal and not permitted under the PRL. 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HS4L-2FIgBDSrHGana-2FLpLlsj8PZ-2B8QPjL1HPo2g1qgKLwXvbvIcqX6KFSHItv6e7TxJrqyBqQCmlvCZcoRtV1Kck-3DK0fV_uUCRg9kCIQTNNp-2FI3QiyckOgRzamtqtdqYaZQq8CDM2r3VDEOiJYGFXrBOXcOwDeezB8ku685c50hWKSfXjJ-2BAnCyBaA5nI-2BAydACHVZ07W5WEHtjVRXLlwTh1HvwyNQRRIu2WxhwNqkoXyxt5YlxBYQqzx8pKDk-2F3Xv6wTgfaKSqnGwbKbuFYWchrDT8FAdcOMjSuZoy1uhh4JS4XakBOfMFZH0djf589az2lOXVpjF7-2Flc-2BTqIiCzRWkHwc35-2FQqDmNuFAAdTU4O6OgfSp-2BbZYhLPj-2FXveWYktgA9ZcAQVEIIRHUgEmL8O3eIZEZLIq-2BFIvzbKgweP1dlly1XhJ9cEGqgDvdgREbdTzjNofNEt02yHV9niwFrGbcZ0P-2Fe9)
